label: 駅家
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: (alt., ekika) Post stations whose construction at 16-kilometer intervals along the seven circuit highways (shichidō) of the tennō's realm was mandated by the 　ritsuryō codes. Horses and necessary provisions were to be maintained at the stations for use by official personnel travelling on royal business. The identity of the latter was to be demonstrated by possession of special post bells." Provincial governors were responsible for maintenance of the post stations. [七道、天皇、律令] "
